entry.title: Grouping Feature in PLD Layout for Document Printout (SAP B1)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We’re planning to use SAP PLD for document printouts instead of Crystal Reports, but it seems the feature to group identical items isn’t supported in PLD.

Can anyone confirm if this feature is unsupported in PLD at all, or just unavailable in older version?

By the way, any tips or workarounds would also be appreciated.

entry.title: Grouping Feature in PLD Layout for Document Printout (SAP B1)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We’re planning to use SAP PLD for document printouts instead of Crystal Reports, but it seems the feature to group identical items isn’t supported in PLD.

Can anyone confirm if this feature is not available in PLD at all, or just not available in some versions?

Any tips or workarounds would also be appreciated.

entry.title: No Quantity Subtotal in Serial Number Transactions Report
entry.content:
Hi All

Is it confirm there is No Quantity Subtotal in Serial Number Transactions Report? 

There is no System Report to show only Available Serial Number Quantity on Hand?

 

Kedalene Chong

entry.title: Cancel Incoming Payments through Service Layer with specific date
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm trying to set a specific date for the cancellation of an Incoming Payment through the Service Layer:

POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v1/IncomingPayments(123)/Cancel

I've tried including different fields in the request body, such as:

{"TaxDate": "YYYY-MM-DD"}
{"DocDate": "YYYY-MM-DD"}
{"DueDate": "YYYY-MM-DD"}

However, none of them seem to affect the date reflected in the General Ledger (GL).
The GL still shows the original document posting date instead of the cancellation date.

I’ve checked the Service Layer documentation, but I couldn’t find any property that allows sending a body or specifying a cancellation/posting date.

Is there any supported way to control the posting date of the cancellation entry in SAP B1?
Or is this behavior fixed by the system?

(Attached is an image of the GL section where we expected the cancellation date to appear.)

entry.title: Adobe PDFMaker Add-on requiring sign in
entry.content:
A few clients of ours use SAP Business One and have so for years. Recently Adobe updated and they are being required to sign in to an Adobe account when using the PDFMaker Add-On. If they click out, it closes. If they sign in with their business email, it prompts to buy a license or start a trial. If you click out, it closes.

I can't seem to find a direct answer, work around, or solution.

Thanks

entry.title: PDF auto open
entry.content:
Hi All

How to prevent the PDF page automatically opens after printing and Saved in PDF?

 

Kedalene Chong

entry.title: [DI API] - Landed Cost based on GRPO with Cost lines (OALC) - Error
entry.content:
Scenario:

Newly added GRPO (clean)

Static example test:

            globals.oCompany = (SAPbobsCOM.Company)Application.SBO_Application.Company.GetDICompany();
            SAPbobsCOM.CompanyService companyService = globals.oCompany.GetCompanyService();
            SAPbobsCOM.LandedCostsService landedCostsService =        (SAPbobsCOM.LandedCostsService)companyService.GetBusinessService(SAPbobsCOM.ServiceTypes.LandedCostsService);

    

            // Landed Cost document
            SAPbobsCOM.LandedCost landedCost = (SAPbobsCOM.LandedCost)landedCostsService.GetDataInterface(SAPbobsCOM.LandedCostsServiceDataInterfaces.lcsLandedCost);

            landedCost.VendorCode = this.EditText2.Value;
            landedCost.PostingDate = DateTime.Today;
            landedCost.ActualCustoms = 0;
            

           
            var itemLine = landedCost.LandedCost_ItemLines.Add();
            itemLine.BaseDocumentType = SAPbobsCOM.LandedCostBaseDocumentTypeEnum.asGoodsReceiptPO;
            itemLine.BaseEntry = 15904;
            itemLine.BaseLine = 0;
            itemLine.Quantity = 1;
            itemLine.Warehouse = "01";
            //itemLine.AutomaticExpenditure = SAPbobsCOM.BoYesNoEnum.tYES;


            //Adding one cost line for transportation(02)

            var costLine = landedCost.LandedCost_CostLines.Add();
            costLine.LandedCostCode = "02";
            costLine.amount = 100.00;
            costLine.AllocationBy = SAPbobsCOM.LandedCostAllocationByEnum.asCashValueBeforeCustoms;
            costLine.CostType = SAPbobsCOM.LCCostTypeEnum.asFixedCosts;
            
            

            var result = landedCostsService.AddLandedCost(landedCost);

 

result returns Error: Both expenditure and customs expenses are missing

I did refer to the existing old posts (some of which have broken links now)


landed-cost-using-di-api/qaq-p/10820456 

both-expenditure-and-customs-expenses-are-missing-in-landed-cost/qaq-p/11213231 

quot-both-expenditure-and-customs-expenses-are-missing-quot-error-in-landed/qaq-p/5626229 

But without any concrete resolutions to the issue. 


Additional Context:

select DocEntry, ItemCode, Quantity, Currency, Price from PDN1 where DocEntry = 15904
Select * from OALC

Results:

DocEntry	ItemCode	Quantity	Currency	Price
15904	CEP000010	1.000000	USD	3.680000

AlcCode	AlcName	OhType	AcctCode	DataSource	UserSign	LaCAllcAcc	CostCateg
01	Landed Costs	F	NULL	I	1	212020900	NULL
02	Transport/Other Services	F	NULL	I	7	212020900	NULL
03	Freight Charges	F	NULL	I	7	212020900	NULL
04	Service & Attendance	F	NULL	I	7	212020900	NULL
05	Demurrages	F	NULL	I	7	212020900	NULL
06	Repair fees 1	F	NULL	I	1	212020900	NULL
07	Repair fees 2	F	NULL	I	1	212020900	NULL
08	RMA & Rework	F	NULL	I	1	511010220	NULL

Duty Groups (Setup)

Name	Number	Duty	Purchase	Other	Total	Duty Allocation Account	Duty Expense Account	
Duty Exempt	0					212020900	212020900	
Customs Exempt	0					212020900	212020900	
Non-EU	0					212020900	212020900	
EU	0					212020900	212020900

What seems to be the issue that i cannot identify that leads to having this error while i have a manual GRPO Landed cost document as seen here:

Select DocEntry, Descr, DocCur, DocRate, BeforeVat, DocTotal, CostSum, CostFactor  from OIPF where DocEntry = 3646

Select * from IPF2 where DocEntry = 3646


DocEntry	Descr	DocCur	DocRate	BeforeVat	DocTotal	CostSum	CostFactor
3646	Based On Goods Receipt PO 2501234,	EUR	0.876040	203.630000	203.630000	95.930000	89.070000



DocEntry	LineNum	AlcCode	OhType	CostSum	CostSumFC	Factor	CostType	Locked	LaCAllcAcc	CostSumSC	InCustCalc	OpenCost	OpenCostFC	OpenCostSC	AgentCode	AgentName	CostCateg	EncryptIV
3646	0	02	F	21.730000	19.040000	20.180000	F	N	212020900	19.040000	N	21.730000	19.040000	19.040000	S00233	[REDUCTED]	NULL	NULL
3646	1	04	F	74.200000	65.000000	68.900000	F	N	212020900	65.000000	N	74.200000	65.000000	65.000000	S00233	[REDUCTED]	NULL	NULL

Do bear in mind that we are talking about a perpetual inventory system:

Select OADM.InvntSystm, OADM.ContInvnt from OADM

InvntSystm	ContInvnt
A	Y

I'm pretty sure @ANKIT_CHAUHAN will be disappointed in me posting this as it has probably been mentioned again and again by him on some post but even in the SDK sample for continuous inventory system, the method name is "test_NonContinue_LandedCost()" but the SDK help file title is Landed Cost in Continuous Inventory Systems which makes it confusing as to which one is the proper one!

I appreciate your time and help experts. let me know!

Regards @ens_

entry.title: Convert Sales Order - Item to UoM - RDR1
entry.content:

The item was set to manual, then I set it to be 12-CS/PK - so there are 12 EACH in 1 case, the inventory UOM will be EACH.

Does anyone have a DTW for RDR1 that they can share for this purpose?

entry.title: Credit Card Management in SAP B1
entry.content:
I am trying to Post Credit Card Vouchers in SAP B1 using Deposit Form But system gives me an Error Amounts could Not be Reconciled ...

On General Setting window I configure the setup Credit Card Vouchers (Automatically) On Incoming Payments we create the Incoming of Lets say 02/09/2025 but while depositing at Deposit Date lets say 23/10/2025 it gives me an error Amounts could not be reconciled ...

entry.title: Cost Price of item unexpectedly zero
entry.content:
Hi,

I have an item that gets purchased and sold regularly. Valuation method is Moving Average.

All of a sudden the Cost Price is zero, but the Inventory Audit Report shows a value of 0.77 on the last row:

The only out-of-the-ordinary transaction is the last row nr. 1715. A Purchase Invoice that corrects the incorrect price that was used in the Goods Receipt P/O, row nr. 1698. The invoice was backdated.

How did the system calculate a moving average cost price of zero?

Regards,

Johan

entry.title: DI API Connect using a Windows Service
entry.content:
I’m trying to make an SAP Business One (DI API) connection in a loop, iterating through several companies (CompanyDB) to connect to each one individually. Even though the user credentials and database names are correct, some databases return an error during the connection.

The company.Connect() method returns a non-zero value, and GetLastError returns the message: "-146 Tenant is no exist".

The credentials are correct (we can log in to SAP normally), the CompanyDB name is correct, and the server type (dbServerType) is being set appropriately (HANA or SQL Server).

However, the error still appears. What could be causing this?

entry.title: B1SiteUser is Disabled – Unable to enable it
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m facing an issue with B1SiteUser being disabled on SAP Business One SQL version SP 2408.

I’ve tried the following methods:

Adding a user for logging into the Authentication Service (Keycloak):

I set up the user in the system variables, but it didn’t work in Keycloak.

Resetting B1SiteUser using the SAP Business One reconfiguration wizard:

The wizard runs, but at the final step I get the error:
“System Landscape Directory contains no compatible database instances.”

I’m not sure how to proceed to enable or reset B1SiteUser properly.

Has anyone encountered this issue before or can guide me on how to resolve it?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: How to increase the number of valid values of a combo box from default 100
entry.content:
Hello,
 
I am doing a SAP B1 web client extensibility project using UI API extensions (VSCode) in which on a UDO form , I am adding a custom grid.One of the column in the custom grid is of type combo box.
I am filling this combobox using a field from another UDO. The problem I am facing is that even if the service layer response gets back around 316 records from that UDO,
The combobox only shows 100 records listed.So I am not able to select other values.
 
How can I increase the number of valid values in that combo box.My combo filling code is given below. Also the layout file setting of the combocontrol is given. Can anybody help?
I tried setSizeLimit() for the datamodel,It is not allowed in web client UI API.
 
************* Combo filling code*********************************
 
 async POLineFill(oEnv) {
      try {
        console.log("POLineFill started");
        const oView = await oEnv.ActiveView();
        
        await oView.setCustomizedData(null, "data3");
 
        const service = await oEnv.getService();
        let response = await service.ServiceLayer.get("TWBS_CM_CONT?$select=U_POLine");
        
        if(!response.isSuccess()){
          console.log("Service call failed in POLineFill");
          return;
        }
 
        let podata = response.getData();
        let allItems = new Map();
        console.log(`Fetched ${podata.value.length} POLines from first page`);
 
        // Add empty option
        allItems.set("", { key: "", text: "", id: "empty-option" });
 
        // Process initial data
        podata.value.forEach((item, index) => {
          if (item.U_POLine) {
            allItems.set(item.U_POLine, {
              key: item.U_POLine,
              text: item.U_POLine,
              id: `poline-${index}`
            });
          }
        });
 
        // Handle pagination
        let nextUrl = podata['@odata.nextLink'];
        let pageIndex = 1;
        console.log("Next url  for pagination:", nextUrl);
 
        while (nextUrl) {
          let nextResponse = await service.ServiceLayer.get(nextUrl);
          if (!nextResponse.isSuccess()) break;
          
          let nextData = nextResponse.getData();
          
          nextData.value.forEach((item, index) => {
            if (item.U_POLine && !allItems.has(item.U_POLine)) {
              allItems.set(item.U_POLine, {
                key: item.U_POLine,
                text: item.U_POLine,
                id: `poline-${pageIndex}-${index}`
              });
            }
          });
          console.log(`Fetched ${nextData.value.length} POLines from page ${pageIndex + 1}`);
          nextUrl = nextData['@odata.nextLink'];
          pageIndex++;
        }
 
        // Convert to array
        const comboBoxData = Array.from(allItems.values()).sort();
 
        console.log(`Total unique POLines loaded: ${comboBoxData.length}`);
 
        await oView.setCustomizedData({ comboBoxData }, "data3");
        
        
        console.log("POLineFill completed");
        
      } catch(error) {
        console.error("Error in POLineFill:", error);
      }
    }
 
************   layout file***********************************
 
                                             "columns": [
 
{
"ctrlType": "b1.sdk.Column",
"guid": "k12qZkmVovquw6fXLmRxqz",
"text": "Choose PO Line",
"template": {
"ctrlType": "b1.sdk.ComboBox",
"guid": "dcmfTcU59HCwny9WxkWMZy",
"editable": true,
"enabled": true,
"showSecondaryValues": true,
"filterSecondaryValues": true,
 
 
"items": {
"path": "@@data3>/comboBoxData",
"length": "{@@data3>/comboBoxData/length}",
"template": {
"ctrlType": "b1.sdk.Item",
"key": "{@@data3>key}",
"text": "{@@data3>text}"
}
},
"change": {
"procName": "onPOComboChange"
  }
}
}
 
 
 
 
 
Thanks,
 
Deepesh

entry.title: Browser Access not working from user system (same network) — SAP Business One
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I need some help configuring SAP Business One Browser Access.

I have successfully installed the Browser Access on the server and can access it locally using the following URL:

 
https://<ServerName>:<Port>/dispatcher

It opens and works fine when accessed from the server system.

However, when I try to access the same URL from a user system (which is under the same network), it does not open.

Here’s what I’ve done so far:

  • Browser Access Service installed and running on the server.

  • Tried using both the server name and IP address in the URL.

  • All users are on the same network.

    Could someone guide me if I missed any configuration steps?
    Do I need to make any changes in the firewall settings, SSL certificate, or hosts file for user systems to connect successfully?

    Any insights or troubleshooting steps would be appreciated.

    Thanks in advance!

     SAP Business One, version for SAP HANA SAP Business One  SAP Business One Extensibility

entry.title: Why Choose SAP Business One Over Traditional ERP for SMEs?
entry.content:
Why Choose SAP Business One Over Traditional ERP for SMEs?

Article Teaser:
Small and mid-sized businesses often struggle with large ERP systems built for big corporations. SAP Business One offers a leaner, smarter alternative designed specifically for SMEs. But what makes it stand out? Let’s explore the differences and why it often wins.

A Simple View: Traditional ERP vs SAP Business One

Traditional ERPs are powerful but they come with high cost, long setup time, and heavy processes. For many SMEs, this means delays and overhead.

SAP Business One is built for smaller operations. It connects finance, sales, inventory and operations in one system. It supports on-premise or cloud deployment. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

Key Advantages for SMEs

  • Speed and Cost-Efficiency: SAP Business One uses fewer resources to deploy and maintain. SMEs can start faster and without heavy budgets. 
  • Built-In Modules for Core Functions: Finance, CRM, inventory, production and reporting all in one system. This reduces silos and errors.
  • Real-Time Insights and Reporting: Leaders make decisions quickly based on live data, not just past reports. 
  • Scalability and Flexibility: Though built for SMEs, the system grows with you adding users or modules as needed. 

When Traditional ERP Still Makes Sense

If your business is very large, highly global, or has ultra-complex processes, a full enterprise ERP might still be the right choice. But for most SMEs needing speed, clarity and cost control, SAP Business One hits the balance.

Practical Example

Imagine an SME with multiple warehouses, global sales, and service calls. With SAP Business One you get:

  • Visible inventory across locations.
  • Sales orders are linked directly to stock and deliveries.
  • Finance sees profit by product, region, or season in a few clicks.
  • Compliance and audits are easier because data is in one system.

Instead of juggling spreadsheets and multiple tools, everything lives in one system made for your size.

Conclusion

For SMEs seeking a business system that delivers strength without the overhead of full enterprise ERP, SAP Business One offers a compelling option. It connects core functions, gives live data to decision-makers, scales with growth, and keeps costs in check.

entry.title: Inconsistent Foreign Key naming in Service Contract (OOAT - OAT1) tables
entry.content: hi experts, I have a question regarding the table structure of the Blanket Agreement (Contract) in SAP Business One. I've observed an inconsistency in the foreign key naming between the header and detail tables, which is different from other business documents in the system. The header table [OOAT] uses AbsId (Integer) as its Primary Key. The detail table [OAT1] uses AgrNo (Integer) as the Foreign Key, which points to [@OAGR].AbsId. In all other major documents (e.g., Sales Order ORDR/RDR1, Invoice OINV/INV1), the header and detail tables use the same field name ( DocEntry) for the primary and foreign key relationship. My Question: What is the historical or design reason behind this naming inconsistency specifically for the Blanket Agreement tables? Why is the foreign key in [OAT1] named AgrNo instead of AbsId to match the header table? This seems to be a unique case, as other master data like Business Partner (OCRD) and Items (OITM) also use consistent names (CardCode, ItemCode) between their header and child tables. I have verified the relationship with an SQL query, which confirms the join is ON [OOAT].AbsId = [OAT1].AgrNo. Any insights into this design decision would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

entry.title: SAP B1 Landed cost is showing correct in Inventory Audit report but total value showing wrong
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We've encountered an issue in SAP Business One related to the Inventory Audit Report. The landed cost values for items are displaying correctly, but the total value in the report appears to be incorrect or inconsistent.
